lissyrtools 0.1.11

Compute Weighted Percentiles Across a List of Data Frames

run_weighted_percentiles.Rd

Applies the compute_weighted_percentiles() function to each data frame in a named list, using a specified variable and optional weight. The function returns either percentile values or share values, depending on the share argument.

Usage

run_weighted_percentiles(
  data_list,
  var_name,
  wgt_name = NULL,
  probs = seq(0, 1, 0.25),
  share = FALSE,
  na.rm = TRUE
)

Arguments

data_list

A named list of data frames, typically from multiple countries, years, or datasets.

var_name

A string specifying the variable name for which percentiles or shares should be computed.

wgt_name

An optional string specifying the weight variable to be used. If NULL, no weights are applied.

probs

A numeric vector of probabilities with values between 0 and 1. Used to determine percentile cutoffs.

share

Logical. If TRUE, returns income shares between percentile brackets instead of the percentile values.

na.rm

Logical. If TRUE, missing values in var_name or wgt_name are removed.

Value

A named list containing the result (numeric vectors) for each element of data_list, with names inherited from the list.

Details

Percentiles are computed using the weighted version of quantile definition 4 from Hyndman and Fan (1996). When share = TRUE, the function estimates Lorenz ordinates by taking quantiles from the running sum of the ordered outcome variable (divided by the total), according to the same quantile definition.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  

# Import data
my_data_list <- lissyuse(data = "es")

# Retrieve the percentile estimates
percentiles_result <- my_data_list %>% 
  transform_negative_values_to_zero("dhi") %>%
  run_weighted_percentiles(
    var_name = "dhi",
    wgt_name = "hpopwgt",
    probs = seq(0, 1, 0.1),
    na.rm = TRUE
)
print(percentiles_result)

# Compute the distribution shares
shares_result <- run_weighted_percentiles(
    data_list = my_data_list,
    var_name = "dhi",
    wgt_name = "hpopwgt",
    probs = seq(0, 1, 0.1),
    share = TRUE,
    na.rm = TRUE
)
print(shares_result)
} # }
